intro: Struthanthus loniceroides, commonly known as the redstem struthanthus, is a perennial shrub native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its woody stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink or red. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Struthanthus loniceroides is adapted to withstand drought and has a low-growing habit with dense foliage.
